title: Killing horizon
summary: In physics, a Killing horizon is a geometrical construct used in general relativity and its generalizations to delineate spacetime boundaries without reference to the dynamic Einstein field equations. Mathematically a Killing horizon is a null hypersurface defined by the vanishing of the norm of a Killing vector field (both are named after Wilhelm Killing).[1] It can also be defined as a null hypersurface generated by a Killing vector, which in turn is null at that surface.
